description:

$ cat /etc/nova/nova.conf | grep DH
network_manager = nova.network.manager.FlatDHCPManager

Create a new network (bridge does not exist!)
/usr/local/bin/nova-manage --config-file /etc/nova/nova.conf network create private 192.168.99.1/24 1 256 --bridge cuccos124

nova boot --image fbc1f160-ed57-4553-908b-c16e66c7735b --flavor 1 --nic net-id=7ea39722-f66a-4b5b-bfc6-5b1b7680d2e4 blahblah

comments.content:
Only the VLAN bridges usually get created in XenServer, the others are assumed to be created by the admin.

nova-network will auto create the bridge, using the flat_network_interface setting, I think. There is no such setting for XenServer side of things.

This is a feature request for nova-network, and all such items are generally rejected, but adding into wishlist for now.

See the code here:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/vif.py#L51
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
Just for the record: This is a bug, not a feature request.

Looking at the vif driver in libvirt:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py#L368

So you will end up in:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/network/linux_net.py#L1472

And that will create the bridge. So in the end: it works in a different way if you are using XenServer.

I agree that it's a low priority thing, as we are moving towards Neutron.
